13 years old.context: Patient, 13 years old, comes to your office with his mother complaining about severe ear pain.

severe ear pain.context: Patient, 13 years old, comes to your office with his mother complaining about severe ear pain.

Chronic otitis media.context: 13 years old complaining about severe ear pain - Chronic otitis media.

afebrile.context: Mom reports that patient has been afebrile with each of the earache episodes, and he has not had upper respiratory symptoms.

no upper respiratory symptoms.context: Mom reports that patient has been afebrile with each of the earache episodes, and he has not had upper respiratory symptoms.

normal pregnancy.context: Patient's mother reports a normal pregnancy with no complications, having received prenatal care from 12 weeks.

hypertension.context: His Dad has hypertension and has frequent heartburn symptoms that he treats with over-the-counter (OTC) medications.

heartburn.context: His Dad has hypertension and has frequent heartburn symptoms that he treats with over-the-counter (OTC) medications.

asthma.context: Mom is healthy and has asthma.

otitis media.context: He had two episodes of otitis media not associated with respiratory infections.

amoxicillin.context: He received antibiotic therapy (amoxicillin) for the otitis media and both episodes resolved without problems.

Pepcid AE.context: Patient's Mom states that he takes no prescribed medications or OTC medications, but he admits that he has been taking his dad's OTC Pepcid AE sometimes when he gets heartburn.

sore throats.context: He does complain of sore throats sometimes and often feels burning in his throat when he goes to sleep at night after a late evening snack.

burning in throat.context: He does complain of sore throats sometimes and often feels burning in his throat when he goes to sleep at night after a late evening snack.

109 pounds.context: Height/weight: Patient weighs 109 pounds (60th percentile) and is 69 inches tall (93rd percentile).

deep red, dull, landmarks obscured, full.context: TMs deep red, dull, landmarks obscured, full bilaterally.

palpable and slightly tender.context: Post auricular and submandibular nodes on left are palpable and slightly tender.

no epigastric tenderness.context: Abdomen: Soft, rounded, reports no epigastric tenderness but states that heartburn begins in epigastric area and rises to throat.

heartburn begins in epigastric area and.context: Abdomen: Soft, rounded, reports no epigastric tenderness but states that heartburn begins in epigastric area and rises to throat.

Stool negative for blood and H. pylori a.context: Labs: Stool negative for blood and H. pylori antigen.

Normal CBC and urinalysis.context: Labs: Stool negative for blood and H. pylori antigen. Normal CBC and urinalysis.

marked GE reflux.context: A barium swallow and upper GI was scheduled for the following week. It showed marked GE reflux.

Gastro esophageal reflux disease (GERD).context: The differential diagnoses for patient included (a) chronic otitis media/treatment failure, (b) peptic ulcer disease/gastritis, (c) gastro esophageal reflux disease (GERD) or carbonated beverage syndrome, (d) trauma.

omeprazole 20 mg.context: Patient and his Mom agreed to a trial of omeprazole 20 mg at bedtime for 2 weeks.

Augmentin.context: He was also given a prescription for 10 days of Augmentin99 and a follow-up appointment for 2 weeks.
